info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MCCURTAIN... NORTHERN FRANKLIN...WESTERN BOWIE...NORTHERN MORRIS...TITUS AND RED RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Raymond Gary State Park, or 14 miles southeast of Hugo, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Clarksville, Hagansport, Boxelder, Idabel, Mount Vernon, Naples, Bogata, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Cookville, Wilkerson, Bagwell, Manchester, Dalby Springs, Valliant, Detroit, Deport, Talco, and Avery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
